sub_topic: Calculation of efficiency of a refrigerator
message_1: A refrigerator operates between 233K and 303K and uses 800 J of work to remove 400 J of heat from inside the refrigerator. Calculate the efficiency of the refrigerator.
message_2:
To calculate the efficiency of the refrigerator, we need to use the Coefficient of Performance (COP) formula for refrigerators:

COP = Q_cold / W

where Q_cold is the amount of heat removed from the inside of the refrigerator (400 J) and W is the work done by the refrigerator (800 J).

COP = 400 J / 800 J = 0.5

The efficiency of the refrigerator is 0.5 or 50%.
